ygData.subject: the soerbaird - question and or sick of hearing about it
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve been to the soerbaird site, and it s very nice looking. You can see lots of bard tales and songs made up by people playing as bards in eq. However:
ygData.messageBody:
I've been to the soerbaird site, and it's very nice looking.
You can see lots of bard tales and songs made up by people
playing as bards in eq.

However: Please! CORRECT ME IF I'M WRONG!

Is all the actual nuts and bolts information you have
compiled about bards locked behind passworded sections
marked "Members Only"?

I may be an idiot and unable to find the information I am
actually interested in (specific tactics, song effects,
bard quests, bard only magic items, bard faction information)
and if so I apologize.

But if I am correct that all such information is secreted away,
then I have heard enough about the clique known as
the soerbairds. If y'all want to go have your private little
group and harvest a bunch of information which you then keep
to yourself, then I for one don't want to hear the
name of your clubby club on this list again. Any information
that I am able to unearth about the bard profession is
public knowledge as far as I'm concerned and I would be happy
to have it repeated to any struggling or curious bard out there.

If I missed a link or something, then I apologize in advance,
and long live the soerbaird :P

Berk Half-Elven
Rallos Zek (a rough place
to sing songs I might add)

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Randy Varnell [mailto:rvarnell@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, April 27, 1999 5:14 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com; eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: Songs descriptions
>
>
> From: Randy Varnell <rvarnell@...>
>
> Hail Roop and bards!
>
> This was an excellent list indeed. I'm compiling a smilar list for the
> Soerbaird and love to hear what other bards have done with songs.
>
> One question I pose to all you bards out there: The Charismatic Carillon--
> I know a few of you have posted that you use this song, and that it has at
> least a minimal affect, but I have not even seen that much. My thinking is
> that the song has not yet been giving the blessing of the gods
> (it is bugged).
>
> Also, could some one advise me of the appropriate way to use this song? Do
> I murmur it to myself, or do I serenade the shopkeeper with whom I wish to
> do business? Do I initiate the trade immediately after I sing, or
> do I wait
> a moment? How long do I have?
>
> I would advocate that this song is more effective than it
> currently is, for
> at the moment it seems to be making no difference in my buying. Of course,
> I am a VERY charming fellow already, and maybe I have found a limit to the
> amount dashing good looks can affect purchasing.
>
> Listen and Live!
>
>
> -----------------------------------------------------
> Jythri, Pencerdd of The Soerbaird
> http://www.soerbaird.com
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Are you hogging all the fun?
> http://www.ONElist.com
> Friends tell friends about ONElist!
>
